title: 148862216.choosing Empathy
excerpt: If I give up the EV charging station for someone else, am I doing it to make myself feel better?

children.text: If I give up the EV charging station for someone else, am I doing it to make myself feel better?
Or am I doing it for the ungrateful unknowing person who will discover an empty spot?
It's a trick question. But not too difficult.
Of course you're doing it for you. Because the oblivious person is just that.
That's what makes it a generous act; no reciprocity.
He doesn't have to notice for you to practice empathy.
And you don't have to know that he cares, or seek credit.
The practice of leaning into someoneâ€™s point of view, of making their world a little better off, of choosing kindness, is a reward in itself.
If you're only willing to embrace it.
